document.masterDocTitle: Lithobius (Monotarsobius) franciscorum sp. nov., a new lithobiid species from the Altai, with a key to the Central Asian species of the subgenus (Chilopoda: Lithobiomorpha)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Lithobius (Monotarsobius) franciscorum sp. nov., a new lithobiid species from the Altai, with a key to the Central Asian species of the subgenus (Chilopoda: Lithobiomorpha)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Central Asian species of subgenus
Monotarsobius
—females

paragraph.keyLead: 2 Claw of ultimate legs simple, without accessory claw......................................................... 3

- Gonopods with 3 + 3 to 4 + 4 spurs................................................
Lithobius fugax
Stuxberg, 1876

7 Four to five ocelli on each side of cephalic capsule............................
Lithobius javanicus (
Zalesskaja, 1978
)

- More than 7 ocelli on each side of cephalic capsule........................
Lithobius muminabadicus (
Zalesskaja, 1978
)

- Gonopods with 3 + 3 to 4 + 4 spurs................................................
Lithobius fugax
Stuxberg, 1876

- Up to 4 ocelli on each side...........................................
Lithobius tuberofemoratus
Farzalieva, 2006

- Second segment of gonopods with setiform spines only............................
Lithobius simplis
Farzalieva, 2006

- 2-3 long setae on the inner face of gonopods.................................
Lithobius ketmenensis
Farzalieva, 2006

- 2-3 long setae on the inner face of gonopods.................................
Lithobius ketmenensis
Farzalieva, 2006

21 Ultimate pair of legs with two coxal pores..................................
Lithobius tarbagataicus
Farzalieva, 2006

- Ultimate pair of legs with three to five coxal pores...............................
Lithobius curtipes
C.L. Koch, 1847

- Gonopods with 3 + 3 to 4 + 4 spurs................................................
Lithobius franciscorum
sp. nov.

26 VpF spines start from 2 nd legs, DaC spines start from 10 th legs.........................
Lithobius insolens
nom. nov.

- VpF spines start from legs 9-10 , DaC spines start from legs 13–15 .................
Lithobius worogowensis
Eason, 1976
